results.title: Senior Software Engineer
results.description:
Senior/Lead Software Engineer (Backend)
Summary:

Sortly has a reputation for simplicity and ease of use; we are seeking Software Engineers with a passion for building customer centric products with the right technology

Outcomes (what you will do):

  • Build awesome systems - Design, Write and Maintain high quality modular code
  • Do code reviews, participate in design & architecture discussions
  • Collaborate within the team for improving tooling and processes
  • Build product features via reliable, performant distributed backend platform and services
  • Participate in occasional on-call rotation of engineers to keep the site up
  • Mentor junior engineers in the team
Job Competencies / Requirements:
  • 3-10 years of experience in product companies writing high quality code
  • Strong knowledge of any coding language & ability to pick up new languages quickly
  • Demonstrated experience of owning and driving a feature/module lifecycle 
  • Demonstrated experience of designing complex systems and solving tough issues
  • Experience working in agile and iterative software development process
  • Ability to think analytically and approach the problems from first principles
  • Working knowledge of AWS and similar cloud technologies is highly desirable
Culture Competencies: 

 

  1. Remote first : Sortly is a remote-first company.  You should be comfortable working with team members in multiple geographies and time zones over virtual channels such as slack, gdocs and zoom calls and potentially travel periodically (say twice/thrice an year for in-person meetings.
  2. Work hours : While you have flexibility to figure out the working hours that suit you, we also require flexibility from you to accommodate meetings in off-normal working hours to be able to collaborate with other members of the team, especially in early PT/ET hours.
  3. Self-Motivated: Self motivated & high ownership on the job without managers needing to keep track of their work hours etc.
  4. Proactive: Acts without being told what to do. Brings new ideas to the company.
  5. Strong Work ethic: Possesses a strong willingness to work hard and sometimes long hours to get the job done. Sets the right expectations and delivers on them. Professional. Punctual.
  6. Excellent Communication Skills: Speaks and writes clearly without being verbose. Articulates complex ideas in simple to understand terms.
  7. Adaptability: Learns quickly. Demonstrates ability to quickly understand and absorb new information.
  8. Growth Mindset: Ability and willingness to pick up new skills. Resourceful. Adapts to new situations.

 

This is a full-time, 100% remote position, open to applicants in India. Candidates must be

eligible to work in India.

results.title: Frontend Engineer
results.description:
Protect Democracy seeks a highly motivated Frontend Engineer to join the VoteShield team.


Protect Democracy was formed in late 2016 with an urgent and explicit mission: to prevent American democracy from declining into a more authoritarian form of government. We are a cross-partisan team that defend our institutions and work to make real the full promise of our democracy by using the courts, legislatures, media, and every other tool available at the state and federal level.


As part of that mission, VoteShield is focused on analyzing voter data as a way to monitor the entire election cycle – not just what happens on election day – to ensure free and fair elections. We believe complete and accurate data are a crucial component of well-run elections. Well-run, transparent elections build voter confidence, and voter confidence is critical to a strong democracy.


In this role, you will be responsible for the web-based interface of VoteShield as part of a small, collaborative engineering team. You will lead with best practices in creating maintainable codebases, drive the implementation of new features, and iterate and experiment with optimal solutions for VoteShield and Protect Democracy at large.


The ideal candidate is detail oriented, has excellent communication skills, and is dedicated to documentation; as well as possessing a flexible, growth-oriented and collaborative mindset, a commitment to excellence, and enthusiasm for our mission. We strongly encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds and from across the political and ideological spectrum to apply. You can work remotely from any location in the United States.


The Frontend Engineer will:

  • Design, architect, and engineer solutions that improve the VoteShield web-based experience.

  • Collaborate with the engineering team to form high-quality solutions to small and large projects.

  • Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to craft solutions that work for everyone.

  • Design and implement interfaces and visualizations that maximizes users’ ability to interpret and explore data and analysis.

  • Document, create, and grow institutional knowledge across relevant areas of work.

  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software that is stable and scalable.

The ideal candidate brings:

  • 7+ years of professional experience in a Frontend Engineer or equivalent role building enjoyable and impactful experiences.

  • Excellent critical thinking skills, ability to reason through novel problems, and good instincts about how to get to optimal solutions.

  • Ability to prioritize, evaluate, and translate the needs of users into productive interfaces.

  • Dedication to documenting work and building institutional knowledge across the team.

  • Proven experience developing high-quality, easily maintainable software.

  • Ability to build solutions that work across browsers and devices, and meet internal and external deadlines.

  • Ability to foster collaborative relationships and work in a team environment with people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.

  • Rigorous attention to detail and the highest standards for excellence in execution.

  • Ability to track, prioritize, and balance a diverse set of responsibilities.

  • Growth mindset and enthusiasm for giving and receiving feedback up, down and sideways.

  • Passion for protecting and improving our democracy and genuine interest in how voting and elections work.


Pluses, but not requirements:

  • Strong visual and interactive design skills with a clear grasp of typography, layout, color, motion and user behavior.

  • Experience working with elections or similar data and understanding the practicalities of working with public data.

  • In-depth experience crafting data visualizations including the ability to choose the most appropriate visualization to accurately represent and communicate data.

  • Knowledge of geospatial systems and visualization and practical experience understanding their limitations.


We know there are great candidates who might not check all these boxes or who possess important skills we haven’t thought of. We value career experiences that include nontraditional pathways including education, breaks, and transitions. If that’s you, don’t hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself.

Compensation

The starting salary range is $110,077 - $129,502, commensurate with the candidate’s relevant experience, capabilities and skills and in alignment with internal equity.

About Protect Democracy

  • Flexible location. You can work remotely from any location in the United States.  The only requirement is that your location be one that allows you to complete the demands of the position and mission. We currently have staff in Washington, DC, New York, Massachusetts, California, Virginia, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Michigan, Georgia, Washington, and elsewhere around the country. Prior to the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic, we offered shared workspaces in those locations for staff members who enjoy working in an office environment, and we are reopening our workspaces in line with current guidance.

  • Commitment to a diverse workplace. Protect Democracy is an equal opportunity employer. Our culture principles emphasize that there is strength in diversity as we believe diverse teams are more innovative, creative, and productive. Protect Democracy encourages applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

  • Competitive pay and phenomenal benefits. In addition to a competitive salary, our benefits package includes: unlimited PTO, three months of paid parental leave, a 401(k) plan with up to 6% employer match that vests immediately, excellent employer-sponsored health, vision, and dental plans, long-term disability and life insurance for all employees, a home office stipend, and as budget allows, discretionary bonuses.

  • Ample opportunities for personal & professional development. Candidates who do not meet all listed criteria should still apply, as our organizational structure focuses on providing mentorship and opportunities for professional growth.


To apply for this position, please follow the application linked below. As part of your application, you will be asked to upload a single PDF that contains your resume and portfolio (or equivalent way of reviewing previous work, such as links). Applications missing any of the required materials will be considered incomplete and not reviewed. Complete applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.


Please contact hiring@protectdemocracy.org if you require accommodations at any point in the application process.

results.title: Staff Full Stack Software Engineer
results.description:
Role summary

As a member of our engineering team, you will work closely with product management, business stakeholders, customer support, and engineering colleagues to develop critical product features and integrate with third-party services in the IoT and energy market spaces.

OhmConnect is expanding internationally, bringing our service to new markets in the United States, Canada, and Australia. Your work will directly support this expansion by building features that meet the needs of a growing and geographically diverse user base, supporting integration with new energy markets, and onboarding new marketing and product partners. You can expect your work to touch the lives and homes of millions of people in the US, Canada, and Australia.

 

Who we are

OhmConnect was founded to improve the lives of people and the health of the planet by reimagining the way we use energy. We are solving massive inefficiencies in energy markets, changing how people use and view energy, and connecting smart homes with the smart grid. We build products that connect deeply with consumers and invite them to take action to positively impact the planet, their communities, and their wallets.

We are an Equal Opportunity employer striving to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment where everyone feels that they have a voice that is heard.

 

What we do

Our products encompass:

  • Consumer facing applications that use home automation control and user behavior modeling to shape consumer energy consumption.
  • Integrations with a growing set of devices and appliances - smart plugs, thermostats, EV chargers, air conditioning, water heaters, etc.
  • Smart Meter data ingestion and analysis for consumer consumption forecast.
  • Bidding, monitoring and settlement processes for energy markets.

What you will do
  • Design, develop, test and deploy new code and maintain existing code.
  • Lead application development projects through all lifecycle stages: from ideation through implementation and to end-of-life from a technical perspective.
  • Monitor application performance: raise, prioritize, and manage issue resolution activities.
  • Work on all aspects of our stack: Python (Flask), MySQL, Javascript (React, TypeScript), GraphQL, Celery, AWS (EC2, ELB, RDS, Redshift, S3, SQS, SES, etc), Ubuntu, Apache, Redis, Git (GitHub), Jira.
  • Perform peer code review and support our Customer Experience team on technical issues, mentor junior developers.
  • Participate in our agile development process - regular team updates, standup meetings, 1-on-1’s.

Requirements

  • Knowledge of server-side languages, especially Python.
  • Solid understanding of SQL databases.
  • Experience with front-end web development — HTML, CSS and Javascript / JQuery. Knowledge of React and GraphQL are a plus.
  • A “systems” mindset: the ability to generalize and apply solutions to a broad set of problems.
  • Dedication to writing clean, robust code, with good unit test coverage.
  • Self-driven, curious, results-oriented; able to thrive in a remote environment.
  • Enjoy a fun, fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Desire for a career that makes an impact through our mission to rally people to change how and when they use electricity — unlocking clean, affordable and reliable energy.
  • Excellent 1-on-1 and team communication skills.
  • Reliability, follow-through, and the technical know-how to solve complex problems independently and share that knowledge with others.
  • 8+ years software development experience preferred.

Benefits

  • A competitive salary based on experience.
  • Fully remote work environment with home office set-up allowance.
  • Real and lived work-life balance - Company perks include unlimited vacation (which our C-level team actively encourages everyone to take!), parental leave, and a corporate values of working sustainably and putting families first.
  • Competitive benefits package that includes full suite of wellness benefits and stock options.
  • Opportunity to work with amazing people who are passionate about halting climate change, thriving in a fully-remote work environment, and learning and growing every day.

Not eligible for visa sponsorship.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Individuals seeking employment at OhmConnect are considered without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender identification, national origin, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital, parental, veteran or military status, unfavorable military discharge, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

results.title: Senior Software Engineer
results.description:
If you haven't heard of us

Staking Rewards is on a mission. Agency is the strategy, passive income from Crypto is one of our tactics in this strategy. We're building tools, platforms and products to help you, ourselves and others to achieve an impactful level of control over their income and help to improve the quality of their investment decisions.

We serve different kinds of stakeholders, investors, analysts and crypto community members worldwide. The narrative we're always pushing is Agency. We want you to be in control. ​​This is why we're on a mission to increase transparency, reduce entry barriers and enable everyone to become financially independent. We make staking easy & accessible.

Let's cut to the chase, Staking Rewards is a close-knit team, 20 some members all working remotely, all over the world. Working here means you pick your own timezone, you pick your own vacation days, have as many of them as you see fit, get compensated well, feel comfortable saying “No” and engage in intelligent dialogues with curious people. The only thing we ask in return is to bring your A-game. Get the job done, with a positive intent and a positive attitude. 

The person we're looking to work with

An Engineer that values quality over quantity. Has a deep understanding of software design and how to apply design principles on different types of problems. Some call them well-rounded Engineers or 10x Engineers, we simply call them good Engineers. 

Good Engineers can learn and adapt. They are creative and curious at all times. 

This is what we're looking for.

You will work with familiar technologies, but you will also be expected to work with unfamiliar technologies, you will learn on the job, you will challenge yourself and the status quo. Most importantly, you will be proud of your work. 

Nevertheless, we expect you have gained a good chuck of experience, about 7-10 years, with different environments in your senior career so far and optimally worked in a Golang environment last so you can bring your A-game from day one.

Engineering at Staking Rewards

In two words, it's comfortable chaos. Our systems are constantly changing, evolving and adapting as the business alongside the crypto market does. Engineering in our environment means constantly facing challenges and being resourceful in our solutions. 

We work the problem. An Engineer at Staking Rewards is expected to inquire, communicate expectations and be open to unusual solutions. Our strength comes from our ability to deliver strong, high quality solutions in an ever changing business environment. 

We keep our feedback loops short and always aim to find the best possible solution together as one Engineering team.

Where do you fit in there?

You become one of the heroes in this saga. An Engineer capable of working on different challenges and storylines.

Some of these challenges we'd like you to focus on are:

  • Building high performing data services
  • Be responsible for happy life - build your own internal tooling
  • Maintain the platform on GCP
  • Bringing a strong defensive security mindset to our code and technical practices
  • Building for others: other developers on the team, for stakeholders and our users
  • Own the full vertical: shape, build, ship, monitor

Sounds good, what now?
  1. You send us your application
  2. Screening Interview with one of our team members (30 min)
  3. Take home coding challenge (max. 5 days)
  4. Interview Day
    1. Challenge Recap & Top grading interview with the CTO / Head of Engineering (60-90 min)
    2. Focused peer interviews (3 x 30 min)
  5. You give us three contacts as a reference that we will reach out to
  6. You will receive our offer
  7. Congratulations, you're part of the Staking Rewards team!

results.title: Full Stack Lead Engineer
results.description:
The successful hire will work exclusively with our AirCrew client, Acclinate.

 

This is a US-based, remote-eligible role. We’re looking for engineers in the Southeastern US, preferably Atlanta, GA but remote US applicants will also be considered. The working schedule will be from 9 AM to 5 PM EST, Mondays to Fridays.

 

Who is Acclinate?

Acclinate is a digital health startup company improving health equity through inclusive research. We help pharmaceutical companies and healthcare organizations access and engage communities of color so their research efforts are more inclusive and reflect the populations they serve.

 

Job Description

We are looking for a talented Full Stack Lead Engineer to join Acclinate’s remote team. As Full Stack Lead Engineer, you will serve in both lead and individual contributor capacity on the engineering team developing Acclinate’s e-DICT platform. Your primary responsibilities will be to translate product features into technical designs (e.g., solution architecture) and tasks for e-DICT engineers, and directly support the implementation of each release. You will report to the VP of Product and Technology, work alongside e-DICT’s product manager, and oversee 3-5 engineers.

 

Requirements

  • 5+ years in an engineering leadership role (e.g. senior engineer, engineering manager, tech lead, solution architect, etc.)

  • Demonstrated proficiency with cloud-native platforms (GCP is preferred, AWS is also acceptable)

  • With experience using data/analytics-specific services

  • Demonstrated experience in developing NodeJS-based applications, with exposure to NestJS, Angular and/or React (Angular is preferred)

  • Experience designing and implementing event-driven systems with a microservice architecture

  • Experience leading in agile environments and leveraging supporting agile stacks (e.g., Jira/Confluence)

  • Experience developing solutions in healthcare or other highly regulated industries would be preferred

  

Responsibilities 

  • Participate in product and release planning processes by providing estimates of the technical feasibility of e-DICT product features

  • Produce technical design artifacts - e.g. solution architecture options, data modeling, API specifications, etc. - to guide the development of features

  • Define and assign development tasks to engineering team members

  • Execute high-priority development tasks as a part of the engineering team (e.g. product development, environment staging, platform deployment, troubleshooting etc.)

  • Champion industry standard development practices and define/document engineering processes (e.g. coding standards, development workflows/tools, etc.)

  • Perform code reviews and approvals

  • Provide mentoring and coaching to junior team members

results.title: Developer Relations Marketing Manager (Developer Advocate)
results.description:
Location: Vancouver or remote within Canada

We are looking for a talented and experienced Developer Relations Marketing Manager to join our team and will champion and promote our solutions to the developer community. Reporting to the Director, Product Marketing, you have a proven track record in leading conversations with technical users and developer audiences via a wide range of platforms and mediums, and have an uncanny ability in generating valuable content that speaks to their hearts.

You are also an effective communicator who can create effective positioning and content, and collaborate well with cross-functional teams to drive go-to-market strategy and to power product launches, as you will play a key role in shaping PDFTron’s messaging and positioning, influence the product roadmap and bring market and customer insights to R&D.

You have a creative mindset that thrives in a flexible and fast-paced environment, and you are eager to venture into the unknown and knock down roadblocks on your quest to deliver results.

Responsibilities

  • Build and manage marketing initiatives that differentiate us in the marketplace by creating unique and meaningful campaigns that not only help to drive engagement and reach but also build an emotional connection to our developer audience leading to a strong digital experience
  • Lead the conversation and actively evangelize developer communities about PDFTron’s technology advancements to aggressively expand our customer base
  • Identify, build, foster and engage an external ‘community ecosystem’ of our target developers & influencers in their existing communities to amplify our messages. Grow and manage our presence in developer conferences and meetups.
  • Deliver compelling content (e.g., YouTube, speaking at events, publishing/blogging, and through social media) to increase awareness, educate and inspire developers and build PDFTron’s reputation as a leader in this space.
  • Collect and disseminate common use cases, problems and limitations of existing solutions
  • Contribute to product marketing efforts including positioning, messaging and collateral, and to top of funnel demand generation activities. Articulate what our product is and the value it provides to users
  • Leverage data conventionally and laterally to design, inform, evaluate, and optimize what you do
  • Continuously develop your knowledge to keep at the forefront of the document processing, SDK, web apps, API technology industries' landscape, players, and competitors
  • Become a product expert with in-depth understanding of technical aspects of the platform and industry use cases.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Marketing or equivalent in a related field.
  • Strong understanding of how developers build software today (e.g. API, SDK, web apps, etc.)
  • Familiarity with marketing channels such as Discord, Reddit, GitHub, Telegram, Slack and Twitter
  • Experience with a developer-focused product
  • You have experience in all or any of these areas: growth hacking, marketing, sales, partnership development
  • Creative, critical and out-of-the-box thinker with outstanding analytical skills
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Self-driven and able to work independently
  • Naturally data-driven, familiar with analytics and reporting tools
  • Excellent organizational skills and above-average attention to detail
  • Passion for collaboration and continuous learning
  • Ability to work in a fast-growing start-up and tolerance for ambiguity

Benefits

  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience & qualifications.
  • A comprehensive extended benefits package including health, dental and vision for you and your family.
  • A great team environment and resources, supporting you to do the best work of your life and providing unlimited career growth potential.
  • Highly autonomous environment.
  • Virtual bi-weekly lunches and monthly socials.
  • Annual recurring WFH allowance for you to purchase items you need for your home office.
  • Excellent work-life balance.
  • Diverse and inclusive workplace where we all learn from each other.
  • Work remotely in Vancouver, Denver, or Boston, your choice!

 

At PDFTron, we are actively changing the way the world works with documents and digital content as the industry-leading document software development (SDK) technology provider. Companies that want exceptional document experiences for their customers embed our world-class technology into their web, mobile, server, and desktop applications. So you can find our SDK under the hood today used by software companies like DocuSign, Autodesk, IBM, Bentley Systems, and Microsoft; and by traditional companies such as Boeing, Wells Fargo, Thomson Reuters, FedEx, General Electric, and many more.

We are a fast-growing company in the $42 billion document processing market, expanding at a rapid, compound annual rate of 19%. Our growth is driven both organically and through acquisitions, with eleven companies acquired in the past 24 months alone, including iText – one of our top competitors. We were also chosen as one of Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers of 2022 by Mediacorp Canada Inc and among Canada’s best employers for recent graduates with addition to its 2022 Career Directory.

As we continue to grow, the opportunities for career advancement and professional development are massive. We foster an atmosphere of growth and success, with each individual immersed in an exciting, challenging, and entrepreneurial environment with career progression based on merit, not tenure. Guided by a clear company vision, every member of our vibrant team is empowered to be a contributor, innovator, and successful leader.

Ready to join our team?

If you are interested in helping PDFTron deliver on its commitments and taking your career to the next level, we invite you to apply online now. Please note that due to the high volume of applications received, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.
Thank you for your interest in PDFTron.

results.title: General Magic - Director of Technology & Services

About General Magic

We’re an elite squad of designers, developers, system architects, researchers, writers and seasoned Web3 professionals. Our Mission is to make magic happen! We do this by providing solution services for Impact DAO’s. Our clients include ENS, Giveth, The Commons Stack, Token Engineering Academy, DappNode and many others.

Who are we looking for?

We need an experienced Director of Technology & Services to support our team by helping us manage our tech processes and workflows, provide guidance and mentorship to mid- level to junior devs on our team, and be a high level project manager to ensure General Magic continues to define the cutting edge of creating solution services for impact DAOs.

To succeed in this role you must:

  • Be a skilled lead dev and understand Open Source development.

  • Have past experience project managing software-focused products.

  • Manage projects on a high level (including speaking with clients, setting deadlines and planning project roadmaps), and also be willing to get your hands dirty!

  • Be an exceptional communicator of technical solutions and work tasks, both internally within the team and externally with clients.

  • Be a naturally empathic, supportive and organized tech team lead.

  • Be comfortable accepting, giving and applying constructive feedback.

  • Maintain a flexible work schedule, as our team navigates time zones all over the world.

  • Be fluent in written and verbal English.

  • Web3 and DAO experience preferred!

What you’ll be doing

  • You will be a leader within General Magic, and a core member to help us with our business strategy and growth plans.

  • Be a hybrid tech leader, product manager and project manager, who  loves to push the team forward and help us deliver amazing end results to our clients.

  • Be the tech lead for our team and mentor mid-level and junior devs, while  helping us build better processes across our organization.

  • Regularly review work flows and help us constantly improve our dev pipeline and best practice standards.

  • Be the point of contact for key clients;the bridge between the development and project implementation

  • Monitor project budget spending, keep stakeholders updated on progress, escalate any risks and propose solutions.

  • Develop project briefs, reports, and status updates - to share internally and externally.

  • Help us improve existing products, build new products and come up with bespoke products for client needs (writing product requirement documents and user stories).

  • Be comfortable dealing with clients; to satisfy customer requirements and pushing back when needed.

Qualifications

  • 6+ years working as a leader in the tech field.

  • Experience managing teams of 5+ mid-level to junior developers.

  • A hybrid product / project manager that still loves to code.

  • Has experience with the modern JavaScript tech stack (Node JS, React & Next JS)

  • Web3 and DAO experience highly preferred.

Pay and Perks

  • Competitive salary, with higher salary available for those with more experience.

  • Freedom of a flexible work schedule.

  • Work in the remote location of your choice; ideally between Europe, North America, and South America.

  • Crypto payment in a stablecoin.

  • Additional compensation package for future token launches - reap the rewards of what you help create!

  • Flexible vacation time.


 

The ecosystem of decentralized technology is quickly expanding in Blockchain, Web3, Open Source, and future unknown tools. If you value exponential professional growth and learning about new technologies initiatives everyday while contributing to the greater good working across different Impact DAO’s; this position is for you!

We look forward to meeting you and creating the new world of decentralized infrastructure together!
